SEARCH
Module org.klojang.jdbc
Package org.klojang.jdbc

Interface SessionConfig

public interface SessionConfig
SessionConfig objects allow you to fine-tune or modify various aspects of how Klojang JDBC processes and executes SQL. SessionConfig is an interface that provides default implementations for all its methods. The default implementations specify Klojang JDBC's default behaviour. You might want to implement SessionConfig through an anonymous class: 

 SessionConfig config = new SessionConfig() {
   public boolean saveEnumAsString(Class<?> beanType, String enumProperty Class<?> enumType) {
     return true;
   }
 };

Alternatively, you could use the provided "withers" to modify how Klojang JDBC operates: 


 SessionConfig config = SessionConfig.getDefaultConfig().withSaveAllEnumsAsStrings();
Author:
Ayco Holleman

    Nested Classes

    Interface
    Description
    static interface 
    SessionConfig.CustomBinder
    A CustomBinder gives you full control over how values are bound to a PreparedStatement.
    static interface 
    SessionConfig.CustomReader
    A CustomReader gives you full control over how values are extracted from a ResultSet.

  • Method Details

    • getDefaultConfig

      static SessionConfig getDefaultConfig()
      Returns a SessionConfig instance which does not override any of the defaults provided by the SessionConfig instance.
      Returns:
      a SessionConfig instance which does not override any of the defaults provided by the SessionConfig instance

    • getCustomBinder

      default SessionConfig.CustomBinder getCustomBinder(Class<?> beanType, String propertyName, Class<?> propertyType)
      Allows you to specify a CustomBinder for a given Java type. The default implementation returns null, meaning you leave it to Klojang JDBC to bind values to the underlying PreparedStatement. You may ignore any argument that you don't need in order to determine whether to use a CustomBinder.
      Parameters:
      beanType - the type of the JavaBean, record, or Map containing the values for which to specify a CustomBinder
      propertyName - the name of the bean property, record component, or map key for which to specify a CustomBinder
      propertyType - the type of the values for which to specify a CustomBinder
      Returns:
      a CustomBinder for any combination of the provided arguments, or null if you do not require a CustomBinder for any combination of the provided arguments

    • getCustomReader

      default SessionConfig.CustomReader getCustomReader(Class<?> beanType, String propertyName, Class<?> propertyType, int sqlType)
      Allows you to specify a CustomReader for a given Java type and/or SQL datatype. The default implementation returns null, meaning you leave it to Klojang JDBC to extract values to the underlying ResultSet. You may ignore any argument that you don't need in order to determine whether to use a CustomReader.
      Parameters:
      beanType - the type of the JavaBean, record, or Map that will receive the value from the ResultSet. Note that when writing to a Map (using a ResultSetMappifier), this argument will always be HashMap.class because that happens to be the type of Map that a ResultSetMappifier creates.
      propertyName - the name of the bean property, record component, or map key that will receive the value from the ResultSet
      propertyType - the type of the values for which to specify a CustomReader. Note that when writing to a Map (using a ResultSetMappifier), this argument will always be Object.class because we don't know the runtime type yet of the values when the ResultSetMappifier is configured, and Java's type erase feature prevents us from being any more specific beforehand.
      sqlType - the SQL datatype of the column for which to specify a CustomReader. Must be one of the constants of the java.sql.Types, like Types.VARCHAR or Types.TIMESTAMP}
      Returns:
      a CustomReader for any combination of the provided arguments, or null if you do not require a CustomReader for any combination of the provided arguments

    • getSqlType

      default Integer getSqlType(Class<?> beanType, String propertyName, Class<?> propertyType)
      Specifies the storage type (the SQL datatype) for a value. This method will only be evaluated if getCustomBinder() returned null. The return value must either be one of the constants in the java.sql.Types class (like Types.VARCHAR) or null. Returning null means you leave it to Klojang JDBC to figure out the SQL datatype. The default implementation returns null. You may ignore any argument that you don't need in order to determine the SQL datatype. For example, in many cases the type of the value (provided via the propertyType argument) is all you need to know in order to determine the corresponding SQL datatype.
      Parameters:
      beanType - the type of the JavaBean, record, or Map containing the value
      propertyName - the name of the bean property, record component, or map key for which to specify the SQL datatype.
      propertyType - the type of the value whose SQL datatype to determine
      Returns:
      one of the class constants of the java.sql.Types class or null

    • saveEnumAsString

      default boolean saveEnumAsString(Class<?> beanType, String enumProperty, Class<? extends Enum<?>> enumType)
      Whether to save enums as strings (by calling their toString() method) or as ints (by calling their ordinal() method). This method will only be evaluated if getSqlType() returned null. The default implementation returns false, meaning that by default Klojang JDBC will save enums as ints. More precisely: Klojang JDBC will bind enum types using preparedStatement.setInt(myEnum.ordinal()). The target column could still be a VARCHAR column. Whichever option you choose, the reverse process — converting ResultSet values to enums — will always work correctly. It will never require extra configuration. You may ignore any argument that you don't need in order to determine the storage type for enums. To save all enums in your application as strings, ignore all arguments and simply return true straight away.
      Parameters:
      beanType - the type of the JavaBean, record, or Map containing the value
      enumProperty - the name of the bean property, record component, or map key for which to specify the SQL datatype.
      enumType - the type of the enum value whose SQL datatype to determine
      Returns:
      whether to bind enums as strings (true) or as ints (false)

    • getPropertyToColumnMapper

      default NameMapper getPropertyToColumnMapper()
      Specifies the NameMapper to be used for mapping bean properties, record components, or map keys to column names. The default implementation returns an instance of CamelCaseToSnakeUpperCase, which would map "camelCaseToSnakeUpperCase" to "CAMEL_CASE_TO_SNAKE_UPPER_CASE". (It would also map "WordCase" a.k.a. "PascalCase" to "WORD_CASE" and "PASCAL_CASE", respectively, since all characters end up in upper case anyway.)
      Returns:
      the NameMapper to be used for mapping bean properties, record components, or map keys to column names

    • getColumnToPropertyMapper

      default NameMapper getColumnToPropertyMapper()
      Specifies the NameMapper to be used for mapping column names to bean properties, record components, or map keys. The default implementation returns an instance of SnakeCaseToCamelCase, which would map "SNAKE_CASE_TO_CAMEL_CASE" to "snakeCaseToCamelCase". (It would also map "snake_case_to_camel_case" to "SNAKE_CASE_TO_CAMEL_CASE" because the casing of the input string is irrelevant for this NameMapper.)
      Returns:
      the NameMapper to be used for mapping column names to bean properties, record components, or map keys

    • withPropertyToColumnMapper

      default SessionConfig withPropertyToColumnMapper(NameMapper mapper)
      Returns a new instance that is equal to this instance except with the property-to-column mapper set to the specified NameMapper.
      Parameters:
      mapper - the NameMapper to be used for mapping bean properties, record components, or map keys to column names
      Returns:
      a new instance that is equal to this instance except with the property-to-column mapper set to the specified NameMapper.

    • withColumnToPropertyMapper

      default SessionConfig withColumnToPropertyMapper(NameMapper mapper)
      Returns a new instance that is equal to this instance except with the column-to-property mapper set to the specified NameMapper.
      Parameters:
      mapper - the NameMapper to be used for mapping column names to bean properties, record components, or map keys
      Returns:
      a new instance that is equal to this instance except with the column-to-property mapper set to the specified NameMapper.

    • withSaveAllEnumsAsStrings

      default SessionConfig withSaveAllEnumsAsStrings()
      Returns a new instance that is equal to this instance except that all enums will be persisted by calling toString() on them.
      Returns:
      a new instance that is equal to this instance except that all enums will be persisted by calling toString() on them.
